issues.title: Refresh on web browser and avatar doesn't show in public calendar
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce
1. Share on public mode a calendar
2. Go on link to see calendar on other browser or computer (where you are not log on on owncloud)
3. Refresh of web page every 5 seconds and avatar don't show

### Expected behaviour
A public calendar with avatar and custom refresh ?

### Actual behaviour
The public calendar work correctly but refresh is too short (5 seconds) and avatar don't show (only if you don't log in)
There may be a place to settle but I have not found despite days of research.

I don't have screen for refresh but i have one for avatar missing : 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22099903/34914884-f0892990-f91b-11e7-96f9-cafad6d956d7.png)

If i log on with my account, i show avatar on same url share : 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22099903/34914875-d1a441fe-f91b-11e7-9ac4-14fd253a3f21.png)

But my principal problem is refresh time, there is too short (5 seconds).

### Server configuration

**Operating system**: Ubuntu 14.04.5

**Web server:** Apache 2.4.7-1

**Database:** Mysql-Server 5.5.55

**PHP version:** PHP 5.6.32

**ownCloud version:** ownCloud 10.0.0.2

**Calendar version:** Calendar 1.5.4

**Updated from an older installed version or fresh install:** Update ownCloud 9.X.X to ownCloud 10.0.X
(But in fresh install same problem.)

```
"No errors have been found."
```

**List of activated apps:**

```
Enabled:
  - activity: 2.3.4
  - calendar: 1.5.4
  - comments: 0.3.0
  - configreport: 0.1.1
  - contacts: 1.5.3
  - dav: 0.2.9
  - external: 1.2
  - federatedfilesharing: 0.3.0
  - federation: 0.1.0
  - files: 1.5.1
  - files_external: 0.7.0
  - files_pdfviewer: 0.8.2
  - files_sharing: 0.10.0
  - files_texteditor: 2.2.1
  - files_trashbin: 0.9.0
  - files_versions: 1.3.0
  - files_videoplayer: 0.9.8
  - firstrunwizard: 1.1
  - gallery: 16.0.2
  - market: 0.2.3
  - notifications: 0.3.0
  - onlyoffice: 1.1.3
  - provisioning_api: 0.5.0
  - systemtags: 0.3.0
  - templateeditor: 0.1
  - updatenotification: 0.2.1
Disabled:
  - encryption
  - files_antivirus
  - theme-example
  - user_external
```

**ownCloud configuration:**

```
        "instanceid": "oce83af8ac14",
        "passwordsalt": "***REMOVED SENSITIVE VALUE***",
        "datadirectory": "\/data\/owncloud\/data",
        "dbtype": "mysql",
        "version": "10.0.2.1",
        "dbname": "owncloud",
        "dbhost": "localhost",
        "dbtableprefix": "oc_",
        "dbuser": "***REMOVED SENSITIVE VALUE***",
        "dbpassword": "***REMOVED SENSITIVE VALUE***",
        "installed": true,
        "forcessl": true,
        "forceSSLforSubdomains": true,
        "maxZipInputSize": 0,
        "allowZipDownload": true,
        "theme": "",
        "maintenance": false,
        "trusted_domains": [
            "owncloud.squaresoft.fr",
            "owncloud.dgm.ens-cachan.fr"
        ],
        "overwrite.cli.url": "https:\/\/owncloud.squaresoft.fr",
        "mail_smtpmode": "php",
        "mail_smtpname": "***REMOVED SENSITIVE VALUE***",
        "mail_smtppassword": "***REMOVED SENSITIVE VALUE***",
        "secret": "***REMOVED SENSITIVE VALUE***",
        "logfile": "\/var\/log\/owncloud.log",
        "loglevel": 2,
        "log_authfailip": true,
        "logtimezone": "Europe\/Paris",
        "trashbin_retention_obligation": "auto",
        "updatechecker": false,
        "htaccess.RewriteBase": "\/",
        "ldapIgnoreNamingRules": false,
        "updater.secret": "***REMOVED SENSITIVE VALUE***"
```

**Are you using external storage, if yes which one:** no

**Are you using encryption:** no

**Are you using an external user-backend, if yes which one:** for my test platform NO, but LDAP (active directory) for the production

### Client configuration
**Browser:** Chrome 63, Edge 41 (HTML16)

**Operating system:** Windows 10 Fall Creators Update, OSX High Sierra

**CalDAV-clients:** Thunderbird Lightning, Calendar (OSX)

issues.title: Users are unable to create / modify events on the shared calendar
issues.body:
Issue:
- User A creates a calendar and shares it with User B
- User B can see the shared calender, but cann't create or modify events
- Additionally some of the shared calenders aren't showed in "calender" section, but in "subscription"

![2017-12-18 10_22_17-spiceworks - tickets ri offen](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34334575/34098803-dff6a7ae-e3dd-11e7-8fad-ed3b5c3cdb93.png)

----------------

Initial Idea was an OC Upgrade vom 8.1 -> 10 AND Migration to 64bit System

Starting at:
- openSUSE 13.1 i586 (32bit)
- ownCloud 8.1.9
- Calendar 0.7.4

----------------

Did the following:
openSuSE 13.1 to 13.2 (32bit) regarding OC 10 dependencies
System is on
- Apache2: 2.4.10-31.1
- MySQL: 5.6.34-2.23.1
- PHP: 5.6.1-89.1

----------------

- Update ownCloud 8.1.x -> 8.2.x
- Update ownCloud 8.2.x -> 9.0.x
ran into this issue: #800
solved it like this:
go to lib/private/integritycheck/checker.php and just returning false in function isCodeCheckEnforced

----------------

ownCloud Update 9.0 -> 9.1 ... using:
sudo -u wwwrun php occ dav:migrate-calenders
sudo -u wwwrun php occ dav:migrate-addressbooks
ran into the same error -> see "calender issue" above ... fixed it the same way

next error - if I try to activate the calender app - "App Folder already exists", so I did:
rename Foldername to Foldername.old (in app Subdirectory)
Installed the App from Webgui again

----------------

ownCloud Update 9.1 -> 10.x ... next error during "sudo -u wwwrun php occ upgrade"
Repair warning: Please install or update the following apps manually or disable them with ... did it:
occ app:disable activity
occ app:disable calendar
occ app:disable filespdfviewer_
occ app:disable filestexteditor_
occ app:disable gallery

updated all apps using webgui

----------------

next step should be the migration from 32bit to 64bit system...
...but at first I've to fix the calender issue!

Calender worked till "9.1 -> 10.x"

----------------

initially this issue was diskussed at https://github.com/owncloud/calendar/issues/830#issuecomment-352350491 which was opened by SimoneCampinoti ... for clearing up the situation (Simone was talking about "non-proprietary users") DeepDiver1975 decided to separate it and forced me to open a new case...

Best,
Mike

issues.title: Can't add a CalDAV subscription that is user restricted
issues.body:
I tried to add a CalDAV Subscription with a URL like this :

**https://my.url:8080/calendar/caldav/myuser**

This CalDAV Account is restricted for "myuser".
I tried to add the credentials to the URL like:

**https://myuser@my.url:8080/calendar/caldav/myuser**

and 

**https://myuser:mypassword@my.url:8080/calendar/caldav/myuser**


But none of them worked.
I get a 401 Notification.

How can I add a restricted CalDAV Account to my subscriptions?

issues.title: 99/5000 non-proprietary users are unable to create / modify events on the shared calendar
issues.body:
<!--
owncloud 10.0.3
 Calendar 1.5.4
-->
### Steps to reproduce
1. with user A create a calendar 
2. share the calendar to LDAP user B 
3.User A can see 2 time the shared calendar line to User B (the first one with write permission and se second without; in the table oc_dav_shares we can find 2 record one with access = 2 and resourceid = display name the other with access=3 and resource id = user id)
4) User B cannot delete add or modify events




see also 
https://github.com/nextcloud/server/issues/4885

issues.title: Sharing of calendar doesn't work with owncloud 10.0.3.3 and calendar app 1.5.4
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce
1. owncloud is set up from 9.x via 9.1.5.2 to 10.0.0 to 10.0.3.3 (it worked already but now sharing has disappeared)
2. opening calendar of any user and click on "sharing"-icon
3. enter name of any other user and/or pick one from the list of existing users

### Expected behaviour
The checkmark-fields (those to allow modify and share) should appear after selecting one of the valid usernames from the list. 
I looked after the changes written in this commit:
https://github.com/owncloud/core/commit/dcb92b84cf53d10b2d4be3109fad1a002be18225
All changes in those four files shown there are implemented (as part of 10.0.3.3 an calendar 1.5.4, I guess). 

### Actual behaviour
no reaction after selecting a valid username, no access to the shared calendar for the other user.

### Server configuration
I'm using calendar app 1.5.4 on owncloud version 10.0.3.3 on ubuntu 16.04LTS with Apache/2.4.18, mysql, PHP version 7.0.22-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
owncloud is set up from 9.x via 9.1.5.2 to 10.0.0 to 10.0.3.3 (I don't know the exact version steps on that route any more)

Login as admin user into your cloud and access 
http://example.com/index.php/settings/integrity/failed

issues.title: Write permission not working with sharing
issues.body:
<!--
Please report only issues corresponding to the calendar app for ownCloud 9 or later.
The old calendar app, which is compatible with ownCloud 8.2 or earlier, is discontinued!

Please report Migration and CalDAV/sync issues to the core repo at https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues
-->
### Steps to reproduce
1. Create a calendar
2. Share calendar with a specific user and give the write permission
3. create or modify event in share calendar by specific user

### Expected behaviour

### Actual behaviour

When i create and share calendar with a specific user and i give write permission on, there's 2 problems:
- the first is when i refresh the calendar web page and i check the write permission on the calendar that i share, the same specific user appear 2 times, the first have the write right and the second not (give the write permission for the second is impossible)
- the second is when the specific user try to add or modify something in the share calendar, he can't

i need this share function and i don't understand why it doesn't work.

Thanks for your help. 

### Server configuration

**Operating system**:
Debian stretch

**Web server:**
Apache 2.4
**Database:**
Mariadb
**PHP version:**
7.0
**ownCloud version:** (see your admin page)
10.0.1
**Calendar version:** (see the apps page)
1.5.4
**Updated from an older installed version or fresh install:**
Fresh Install

issue_comments.body:
- [ ]  Enable `Sabre\CalDAV\Schedule\Plugin`. This is pretty easy.
- [ ]  Make sure that the CalDAV backend also implements `Sabre\CalDAV\Backend\SchedulingSupport`.

source: https://github.com/owncloud/calendar/issues/228#issuecomment-136650248
Done, also slightly improved the CSS quality.

Currently there seems to be more activity in the calendar-rework (branch). I hope this will lead to a working new calendar app soon, as this is in the work for a long time already. Anyway, maybe it is a good idea to take a little bit more time to focus on implementing a unified Web/Cal/CardDAV endpoint in core and use this in the calendar rework here, see https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues/5939. As far as I know this is a (fartime) goal in core already, with first steps to be found in the private repository of @DeepDiver1975: https://github.com/DeepDiver1975/dav. As it looks like CalDAV still has to be implemented here, this might be the chance to do it right at the first place, instead of doing the same work twice and changing the underlying CalDAV implementation later on.

Any opinions on how the calendar-rework should be handled? @georgehrke @jancborchardt @raghunayyar @DeepDiver1975 @karlitschek

AFAIK there is no ETA for the dav app yet. The current plan is to release rework with 9.0. If the dav app is ready by then and enough time is left, we should definitely remove our own caldav implementation and make use of the dav app. Until then, we need our own one, to be sure, that we can provide a well-tested caldav implementation when releasing rework with ownCloud 9.

@DeepDiver1975 I'm afraid I missed your lightning talk at conf. Is the dav app only supposed to provide a unified interface for web-/card-/caldav or will it also take care of actually managing the calendars and it's corresponding events/journals/todos?
@georgehrke please include the names of the maintainers in the README.md, it's easier for people to reach out that way.
fixes #27

added a maintainers list, only one thing is left:
- [x] update travis and scrutinizer links

Two things:
- [x] I think the spinner is far to big. should not be bigger than an list-item imho
- [x] there is some time span between the server answers the request and the list is rendered. The list should be rendered first thing once the request was answered, please check.
Is there some change from my side required for this to be merge-able?

No, this just needs to be reviewed.
I'll review it Wednesday afternoon, if no one is faster than me
Works fine :+1:
thx for your contribution :smile:
Some love here @DeepDiver1975 :)
- [x] There is a spinner above fullcalendar, please remove it.

I changed this pr, looks good from my pov now.
please review and feel free to merge afterwords.
Works for me, I also see this as faster than it was previously. :+1: x 2.
@georgehrke as discussed, WIP.

Removing lots of stupid dependencies :clap::clap::clap:

cool!
@codeling Would you be interested in implementing this? :-)
@georgehrke Yes, I'm on it!

We can get definitely get rid of fontawesome if get some awesome icons from @jancborchardt. I can supply the list of icons needed, they can be a part of core.

I dont think we need mocks in production, we need it in development. jquery-timepicker is used in the events editor when the all day mode is turned off. We can think of getting rid of that as use the angular date-picker itself.
depends on #1

List the icons you use from fontawesome and where/why you need them.

(Great initiative to question the dependencies!)
https://scrutinizer-ci.com/g/owncloud/calendar-rework/
https://travis-ci.org/owncloud/calendar-rework/
thanks a lot :-)
I think this can be merged now @georgehrke
please rebase
your changes look good, please review mine
please fix the issues I mentioned and rebase. I'll take a look afterwords.
